fields.description:
For instance, not all the commands mentioned in the following page still exist:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Creating+a+Custom+Elastic+Image

The page mentions [ec2-bundle-vol|http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonEC2/dg/2006-10-01/CLTRG-ami-bundle-vol.html] which does not exist in the newer API Tools version.

Similar commands like [ec2-bundle-instance|http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/CommandLineReference/ApiReference-cmd-BundleInstance.html] (which seems equivalent), resulted in the error "Client.InvalidInstanceType: Instance i-6f3bea03 does not support bundling.". 

It seems that the new command may be [ec2-create-image|http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/CommandLineReference/index.html?ApiReference-cmd-CreateImage.html] (not tested).
fields.summary: Documentated instructions don't work any more since a new version of Amazon EC2 API tools was released.

fields.description: On the Job Build Summary page, when you click on remove error from log, the url link does not work properly

fields.description:
As in BAM-7635 but for Git:
Like in Summary - if concurrent builds are on then each local agent will grab its own copy of cache during code retrieval.
Cache should be reused locally for checkouts - conurrent builds or not.

This will require changing cache lock strategy to read/write - see [comment|https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/cru/CR-BAM-2388#c39662]
fields.summary: Share Git cache among the server and local agents (if concurrent builds are on)

fields.description:
In the summary, when a build is actively running and you are in the bottom of the page seeing the latest logs, after new lines are being added the page doesn't keep in the bottom, so you can't see the latest output and are forced to manually scroll. 

This is very annoying specially when you are monitoring a build.

I already showed this to Mark and we were able to reproduced the issue. If you need an example, you could see the screenshots 1 and 2. Please not that 2 is not in the bottom, even though the windows was not touched.

fields.description:
Looking at the code, it also looks like its not auto detected on a new server either.

I would look at adding the plugin stuff into the CapabilityDefaultsHelperImpl (if that works). If not ensure that mercurial exe detection occurs in both AgentRegistrationBean and BambooContainer.setupDefaultCapabilities.

This issue is preventing Fisheye and Crucible from getting TPM builds working.
fields.summary: Bamboo fails to auto detect mercurial executable on remote agent.

fields.description:
We have had sporadic failures with EBS not mounting.  Typically this has been happening Wednesday afternoon at 15:00 australia time.  Amazon AWS is not reporting any outages on their site.  While amazon might be doing some "weekly maintenance", this causes EBS volumes not to mount, and thus java, mvn, etc are not available.  Yet, since the agent runs from the AMI, it reports all good with the bamboo server. 

I've tried moving around on us-east and that doesn't help.
fields.summary: Bamboo elastic agent does not detect if EBS volumes do not mount

fields.description: The operating system used on the current elastic ami is from 2008.  Now that it's three years later, we should give customers the ability to run on a newer OS, with all the great security updates.
fields.summary: Bamboo elastic AMI should have an updated operating system from 2011 instead of 2008

fields.description:
When upgrading to the new Atlassian Plaform, we've changed the expiry scheduler to be triggered by Bamboo start instead of plugin system startup event.
This is a good idea, but the plugin was not wired properly to receive the startup event. As the result, expiry never runs on Bamboo 3.0.
Priority major since the exposure is limited, but this has to be fixed fast.
fields.summary: OAUTH TokenExpiry never starts in Bamboo 3.0

1303 [com.sun.sungrid.service.tunnel.server.TunnelServer] INFO com.sun.sungrid.service.tunnel.server.TunnelServer  - Waiting for tunnel connection.

Doesn't progress further
fields.summary: Support Elastic IPs in Elastic Bamboo

fields.description:
From https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-3860:
DashboardCachingManagerImpl uses PlanManager.getAllPlans(Class<T>) to fetch list of plans to cache. Unfortunately that method is filtered and returns only plans visible to anonymous users. This is a problem when plans are configured to be not visible for anonymous users as they wont appear on the dashboard even for logged in user with proper privileges.
fields.summary: DashboardCachingManagerImpl does not cache all plans

fields.description:
At the moment, build logs streamed from the agent are not buffered when written to the file system. Brydie suggested:

bq. However, another thought to consider, I think we buffer remote/elastic agent logs on the agent side, e.g. we send groups of logs back every 10 seconds. Perhaps if we were looking at optimising the flushes we could look at making sure we flush at the end of each group rather than after each line.
fields.summary: Buffering build logs
Bundle the Git Bamboo Repository Plugin with Bamboo 3.0

fields.description:
1. Considering that anonymous users can't see the plans in the dashboard;

2. If the first access is done in anonymous mode and then the Admin logs in, the Admin Dashboard will be empty, because the anonymous permission for the dashboard is still cached. All the other screens will show the plans and permissions without problem.
fields.summary: Bamboo caches the Dashboard Plan permissions for the first user that accessed Bamboo

fields.description:
Currently you can't bulk action a job which inherits the repository.  It looks like you can, but it wont actually do anything because the inherited property still exists. 

It would be nice if the bulk action would override this property, you could use the parents repository settings for all the other fields that you need.

Alternatively you shouldn't be allowed to bulk update a job that is inheriting from its plan. (maybe disable the checkbox next to jobs with inherited repos on step 3 of the wizard.)
fields.summary: Better Integrate Inheriting Repository into Bulk Action Logic

fields.description:
To look more Atlassian, our header requires a few changes. Since another project is underway to unify headers in general, we don't want to spend much time on this, but a few small changes can have a big impact here: 

*Change the font:*
* Not Bold
* Remove the underlines for the shortcut keys (not needed very often anyway)
* Change the font size to 13 pixels

*Background*
* Remove the background image
* Use a new logo that works on a plain background (to be provided by Jens)
fields.summary: Update Bamboo Header

fields.description:
The blue box doesn't fit in with Bamboo's new style. We should update it to look similar to the Test Summary. See attached mockup. 

We can definitely play with the size of the numbers. For Plans with a lot of builds, the first number might grow too long at the current size.
fields.summary: Update Plan Statistics UI

fields.description:
We want to simplify the Bamboo permissions and 3.0 is a great opportunity for us to make such a change. The changes are highlighted in the Bamboo Permissions evaluation which should provide enough context to perform the change. 

The main changes are:

* Edit, Admin and Clone (Plan) will become one Permission (Admin).
* Plan Administrators have full access over the Plan including the ability to create Jobs (no longer requires the global "Create Plan" permission.
* Only administrators can disable builds.

Upgrade Tasks:

* Users with Edit Permissions will receive the Admin permission for a plan.
* Users with Clone Permissions will NOT receive Admin permission for a plan and can now only view it.
* The build permission will not be changed.
fields.summary: Simplify Bamboo Permissions

fields.description:
Essentially they were using the same code as the big blue box to update, removing the blue box means they dont work anymore...

Jason is aware of this, but thought I would raise an issue for prosperity.
fields.summary: Live logs on job summary page dont work anymore

fields.description: The results navigator uses the non pretty url, but the plan navigator relies on the pretty url.  So if you use the results navigator then the plan navigator you will not remain in the same context (i.e on the same tab)
fields.summary: Results Navigation Screws up Plan Navigation Context by not using the pretty URL

fields.description: We have a whole bunch of "latest" directories lying around for artifacts. These are no longer used so don't actually hold the latest data anymore.  We should just remove them.
fields.summary: Upgrade task to remove "latest" artifact directories

fields.description:
See BAM-7665 for background information.

Git needs the username to be in the URL for ssh.

By implementing BAM-7665, we error out whenever a git ssh URL is entered without a username.

I think it would be better if we provided a separate UI textfield for the username and embeded the username into the ssh URL.

In this case if the user enters a username into the URL we should error out and ask the user to enter the username into a separate UI field.
fields.summary: Rather than error out when a git ssh URL is entered without a username, automatically embed it in the URL for the user

fields.description: when run on remote agent no log from GitRepository are shown. Probably textProvider is not properly initialized/loaded - as it was in MercurialRepository.
fields.summary: Git Repository doesn't log messages on remote agents

fields.description:
There are some issues with Bandana data I've noticed in connection with OAUTH plugin and the way Bamboo handles persistence for plugins. We cannot tell whether the bugs that caused this have been resolved, it's best to run an upgrade task and observer how things work after that. These issues are not critical.
# OAUTH stores special keys with a list of all keys stores in the data store (like an index). These lists should appear once per list of tokens. I've found duplicates, which means that one of these lists is never expired.
# I've also found cases when there were OAUTH tokens that were missing from the token list. These tokens will never be expired.
# BambooPluginSettings remove() method does not actually remove records, it sets them to null - in case of OAUTH this means that thousands of OAUTH records will be added to the database and never removed. This may have performance impact after a year or so.
fields.summary: Bandana data cleanup

fields.description: Currently there has to be something declared in goals field in order to be able to save the configuration. Maven supports build>defaultGoal declared in pom making it possible to execute maven without goals and I'd like to utilize this feature.
fields.summary: Allow maven to be executed with default goal

fields.description:
I came across the following tweet today and was wondering if anyone knows whether that's quick and easy to do... and what benefits it would provide? I guess starting up would be easier and more standard?

Dear @atlassian, please include init.d scripts (start / stop / restart) for #bamboowithin your packages.
source: http://twitter.com/#!/pabelanger/status/21982552029925376
fields.summary: Create init.d scripts (start / stop / restart) for Bamboo

fields.description: To create a better association with Ribbon, we should use the status colour of a Plan or Job in the Plan navigator for results.
fields.summary: Use status colour for highlighting current Plan/Job in Plan Navigator

fields.description:
# Go to the view authors page. 
# Click on a column to sort e.g. score

The ordering is incorrect as it thinks 9 is higher than 88 etc. Sorting of negative numbers are all wrong too.
fields.summary: Sorting columns on the authors page is not correct

fields.description:
If there is an override in client mapping:

//Depot/trunk/foo/... //client/foo/...
+//Depot/branch/foo/libbar/... //client/foo/libbar/...

Changes in //Depot/branch won't trigger the build.
fields.summary: Perforce repository changes are not detected if "+" mapping is used

fields.description:
I committed revision: https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/changelog/confluence?cs=137584 and it triggered this build: https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/CONFFUNC-MAIN-8233/
The code changes on the build summary correctly reports that revision.

I then committed again for the same jira issue and for some reason the previous revision and the new commit is both showing in this build's code changes: https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/CONFFUNC-MAIN-8235

Shouldn't r137584 only have shown up in build 8233? Why does it show up again in 8235?
fields.summary: Incorrect code changes reported by bamboo builds

fields.description:
Our UI allows to provide username and password for ssh:// protocol in separate fields
jGit implementation requires that the username is embedded in the protocol - if it's not, it will be taken from the ssh config.

We should handle this case by changing the uri if we see it's ssh:// and the username is set in the field.

We should at least mark it as an error during form validation - actually, this may be the right approach (signal error only, no uri tweaking)
fields.summary: jGit requires that username for ssh:// protocol is embedded in the url

fields.description:
I tried "change key" -> leave the input empty, but it just gets ignored - the key stays there.
I can imagine user wanting to remove the key for security reasons or whatever
I wanted to switch to username/pass auth for tests.

The workaround is to upload an invalid file, but it's not perfect.
fields.summary: There is no way to clear the keyfile from Git repo configuration

fields.description:
This may already be catered for but:

Its possible that moving artifact files will run out of disk space in the middle.  We should make sure that the upgrade task dies elegantly and its possible to recover. e.g. (just re-run the upgrade task and it picks up where it left off.)
fields.summary: Ensure Artifacts upgrade task gives decent errors and can be rerun

fields.description:
This, of course, is correct behaviour. However, it currently doesn't provide any feedback. The link simply doesn't work. Instead, can we display a popup with the following message:

"To share an Artifact, it's name must be unique within the Plan. Please rename the Artifact to share it"

Then allow the user to edit the Artifacts name with a textbox. (just like in edit without all the other fields)

The buttons at the bottom should say: Save and Cancel
fields.summary: Sharing an artifact via quick link doesn't work when artifact name is used by other Jobs

fields.description:
Raised from BSP-3765. The customer reported massive slowdowns/lockups and OOMs after running Bamboo for ~2 days.
Customer export contains 15 000 of expired access tokens and 30 000 of expired consumer tokens. Due to implementation of cleanup process in SAL plugin, a cleanup of these records requires 675 million (give or take a couple million) database queries. This obviously never finishes in time - the amount of tokens added to the installations easily exceeds the capacity of cleanup. This ties down database connections and causes Bamboo to become unresponsive.

Bug for the root cause raised here: OAUTH-172 , bug for the expiry process will be raised later.
Need to upgrade SAL plugin after the root cause and the cleanup implementation is fixed.
fields.summary: bug in OAUTH plugin causes lockups in Bamboo

fields.description: as it mislead user thinking user/pass may impact ssh connection. Ideally there should be combobox "authenticationType" with options "none;http auth;sshKeyfile" which would display exclusively either user/pass, either ssh+passphrase, or nothing.
fields.summary: Git Repository shouldn't display user/pass + sshKey/pass together
Git Plugin should detect if remote repository support 'shallow' protocol

bq. I went through the cache directories in the server and noticed also slight security issue. fields.description:
Today, agents' capabilities are static, an agent either has a capability which was created or not. Also, build plan requirements are also static.
I really need a dynamic capabilities for agents and build plans, as it can really help in solving a few cases which today Bamboo can't solve.

For example, i'm using build plans which run tests on lab machines. My lab consists of a lot machines (~20 today), where each build plan can use a few machines from the lab. Today, the only solution i have, is to use a static agent capability (for only 1 agent), and a static requirement capability for each build plan that uses (even one) machines from the lab. On one hand, this allows me to use Bamboo to prevent concurrent build plans which need the lab, but on the other hand, prevents me from running build plans concurrently if they use different machines in the lab.

The solution for this, can be *dynamic requirements and capabilities*:
* A build plan requirement will be defined to be a result of a script/exe which will be run pre-build by Bamboo
* An agent capability will be defined to be a result of a script/exe which will be run pre-build by Bamboo

Developing dynamic in either agents or requirements, will probably allow me to solve this problem.

Do u think you can help me with this?
fields.summary: Agents capabilities and build plan requirements are static, prevents advanced uses of Bamboo

fields.description:

For example, here's a valid log (from a bad build): https://bamboo.developer.atlassian.com/browse/REFAPP-TNKINT-JOB1-157/artifact/Logs/platform-projects/UPM/plugin/target/refapp-2.7.0.log
And here's a corrupt log (from a good build): https://bamboo.developer.atlassian.com/browse/REFAPP-TNKINT-JOB1-158/artifact/Logs/platform-projects/UPM/plugin/target/refapp-2.7.0.log

This is problematic because it is often useful to compare a server log from a good build with that from a bad build in order to investigate build breaks.
